subject: p12658295
History: -year-old male with unwitnessed fall, evaluate for traumatic injury.
Findings: The lungs are well expanded and shows a right lower lobe opacity. The cardiac silhouette is enlarged. The mediastinal silhouette and hilar contours are normal. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is present.
Impression: Right lower lobe atelectasis with a small associated effusion, better assessed on concurrent CT.
